attributes.action: Ban UKPC from being able to recieve driver information from the DVLA.
attributes.background: On Mon 11/1/16 the BBC will air a broadcast about UKPC within their Inside Out West Midlands at 19:30 GMT. This will be avaliable on the BBC iPlayer afterwards also. UKPC have been found on the 9/15 to be in vialation and given sanction points. Now they have been found out again. Action is needed.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC Inside Out West Midlands is on Monday 11 January on BBC One at 19:30 GMT and available afterwards on iPlayer.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-35253759

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-lincolnshire-34402322

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3229165/Is-PROOF-private-parking-firms-scamming-motorists-Drivers-say-timings-photos-doctored-legally-parked-cars-issued-fines.html

http://forums.moneysavingexpert.com/showthread.php?t=4766249

attributes.action: Extend the 'Aiming High for Young People' Plan
attributes.background: The 'Aiming High for Young People Plan' provides young people with funding and comfort, as well as an escape for troubled kids. Without the appropriate places for young people to stay off the streets, crime has statistically increased in these areas.
attributes.additional_details: By next year, the government will stop providing a place of comfort for young people in every consistentuency, the government will stop providing £25 million for teenagers in disadvantaged communities, and the government will stop providing young people influence over local authority funding. This needs to be changed. We, as gatekeepers for the next generation, must make sure the youth develop with the optimum funding and appreciation. The futures of millions of children holds in the balance.

attributes.action: GET WAITING TIMES OF DRIVING TESTS DOWN TO WITHIN 3 WEEKS
attributes.background: WAITING TIMES FOR DRIVING TESTS AROUND THE COUNTRY ARE GETTING LONGER AT THE MOMENT IT CAN BE AS LONG AS 3 MONTHS, THIS IS CAUSING SEVERE PROBLEMS TO PUPILS AND DRIVING INSTRUCTORS . ALSO TESTS ARE BEING CANCELLED  IN THE WAITING ROOM AND THE PUPILS ARE NOT GETTING THE REQUIRED NOTICE .
attributes.additional_details: IN MY AREA OF WORK THE EARLIEST DRIVING TEST APPOINTMENT IS 1ST NOV  THE DATE TODAY  IS 20TH JULY I WOULD CHALLENGE ANYONE IN THE COUNTRY TO FORECAST 3 MONTHS IN ADVANCE WEATHER A PUPIL WILL BE READY FOR THERE DRIVING TEST .THIS WAITING TIME IS NOT CAUSING JUST EXTRA PRESSURE ON A PUPIL TO PASS 1ST TIME BUT ALSO CAUSING THE DRIVING INSTRUCTOR EXTRA PRESSURE AND MAKING US LOOK LIKE COMPLETE IDIOTS. THE DVSA GET PAID FOR A SERVICE THEY ARE NOT PROVIDING CAUSING UNDUE STRESS AND PROBLEMS

attributes.action: I want the mandatory tv licence in September to be abolished.
attributes.background: Come September 1 2016 you will be required by law to purchase a television licence, regardless of how you watch - this includes YouTube and BBC iPlayer etc.
attributes.additional_details:
From the TV licence website - 

No matter what device you use, you must be covered by a TV Licence if you watch or record live TV. This includes:
TV sets
Laptops and desktop computers
Tablets, mobile phones, satnavs and other portable devices
Digital boxes (PVRs), satellite and cable, e.g. Freeview, Freesat, Sky, Virgin Media, BT Vision, YouView, Apple TV, Chromecast, Roku and Amazon Fire TV
Games consoles
DVD, Blu-ray and VHS recorders

http://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/check-if-you-need-one

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wages for 17-20 year olds.
attributes.background: National minimum wage for 17-20 year old's should be increased, wages they receive are not just. Being a 20 year old earning £5.50 p/h is inadequate, knowing how much effort and sacrifice you put into working alongside studying. Yet we are liable for paying adult fares on public transport.

attributes.action: Make the Punishment fit the Crime
attributes.background: Today the Victim does Not get Justice in Many cases, Causing Death by say Dangerous Driving when they get their sentence Cut in Half and winds up around Two years per Life makes life Cheap, they should be Banned for say Ten years and Ten years per life taken, they will not learn by a slap on hand.
attributes.additional_details:
More sentences are stupid when handed out, Victims Must see Justice done for their Loss, many Stupid Boy Racers who should never be on the road for others Safety.

They also Must pass their Test again.

Also this Applies to All other Deaths by whatever means.

Let's Stop Silly Sentences being handed out from the Courts, bet they would not like it for one of their family Members.

attributes.action: Ask for 'EU Membership for Individuals', when negotiating leaving EU.
attributes.background: Education
attributes.additional_details:
A choice for individuals who wish 'To travel/study/work ' for £4:50 week or any other amount deemed reasonable.
It excludes public health and benefits, if no reciprocal arrangement by the EU, since the main cause of  Brexit was the magnetic state benefits package, allowed by the UK.
This is not designed to encourage mass migration, but to allow individuals to persue visa free travel, and to study and work to broaden their horizons, learn languages and foster good relations.

attributes.action: Fertility treatment, artificial insemination and IVF free for lesbian couples
attributes.background: It is wrong to make gay couples pay to start a family. It costs around £1500 per try and not every gay couple can afford this. Lesbians and gay couples should be provided with free fertility treatment. They want to start a family but cannot afford this. They should not be punished for being gay.

attributes.action: Make CPD (Continual professional development) mandatory for the beauty industry.
attributes.background: Most professions in the UK (Dentists, Doctors, Solicitors, Journalists etc... require a minimum number of CPD (Continual Professional Development training hours) to be completed each year. This is training to keep updated in your industry.
attributes.additional_details: The beauty industry needs skilled therapists that are dedicated to improving their skills and remained up-to-date in health and safety of the benefit of both themselves, their clients and the image of this massive industry.

attributes.action: Abolish extra charges for holidays during school holidays for single travellers
attributes.background: Stop or limit the travel compainies charging a premiuim on holidays for people travelling without children during term breaks.
attributes.additional_details: As a single person who travels alone or with friends its unfair that we have to pay extra for a holiday if its during a school break. This also limits the amount of time we can take off work lossing around 8 weeks per year. A holiday for example to spain costs around £150-£250 more at such times. If like myself due to your work (healthcare) you cant take time off during half of November, all of December and half of January because of school break costs it limits exactly what you can have.

attributes.action: Call on the Saudi Arabian leaders to decriminalise homosexuality
attributes.background: In Saudi Arabia, same-sex sexual activity is punishable by floggings, life imprisonment, chemical castration, whipping torture and even the death penalty. People convicted twice are executed. Please call on the Saudi Arabian government to end the suffering of homosexuals in Saudi Arabia.

attributes.action: Make finance a part of the GCSE Maths curriculum.
attributes.background: Children are leaving school into a world they are not aware of financially. Too many young people are taking out Loans and Credit Cards without fully understanding how that will affect them later in life. Make finance a part of GCSE maths and teach students about loans, mortgages and credit cards
attributes.additional_details: I took out a £5000 loan when I was 18. I was in then in a job that enabled me to repay the debt comfortably. Since then I lost that job and have been financially crippled since then. I can no longer get a mobile phone contract, I find it hard to get a private tenancy agreement. None of this or the consequences was I informed of during school. Make information about loans, credit cards and mortgages compulsory in GCSE maths to better equip students for the real world.

attributes.action: Rights to vote for all migrants who have resided in the UK for the past 5 years.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to extend the right to vote for the EU referendum to the migrants that have lived and worked in the UK for the past 5 years. We call a second referendum open to this minority that has not been included in the vote but that will be directly affected by it.

attributes.action: Review Visa requirements of the families of serving Commonwealth Soldiers
attributes.background: I highlight the case of a Fijian Soldier who is serving in the British Army who has been separated from his family due to current UK Visa laws. As this soldier does not earn the £27,000 required, his family are forced to remain in Fiji. He is also required to find £6000 just for a Visa application.
attributes.additional_details: The soldier in question served in Afghanistan then discharged from the Army. He subsequently rejoined into the MPGS. His family moved back to Fiji and are now unable to join him. He has seen his family once for 2 weeks in three years. It is unfair to have free movement within Europe yet serving Soldiers are unable to be accompanied due to archaic Visa regulations

attributes.action: Referendum to choose between negotiated IN and OUT EU plans
attributes.background: On 23rd June the British Electorate was given a choice between remaining in the EU or something else. We did not know what that alternative was. We should give the people of the UK a proper choice between two concrete negotiated plans for our future either in or out of the EU before leaving.

attributes.action: Act against the post-EU referendum increase in racial and religious hate crime
attributes.background: We are ashamed by the reported increase in racially and religiously motivated hate crimes following the EU referendum. We ask politicians to provide additional funding for anti-racism initiatives and community support, and to ensure that the police and CPS investigate and prosecute offenders.

attributes.action: Hold independence referendums for London, Scotland, and Northern Ireland
attributes.background: The people of London, Scotland, and Northern Ireland are at risk of being taken out of the EU, despite voting heavily to remain. If Scotland is granted a 2nd independence referendum as a result of this, then the same choice should be granted to both London and Northern Ireland.
attributes.additional_details:
EU referendum results as reported by the BBC:

London: "Across all 33 boroughs in the capital, 59.9% (2.26 million) voted in favour of remaining in the EU. In some areas, the remain vote was more than 70%."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36612916

Scotland: "Scotland has voted in favour of the UK staying in the EU by 62% to 38% - with all 32 council areas backing Remain."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-scotland-politics-36599102

Northern Ireland: "Northern Ireland has voted to remain in the EU Referendum by a majority of 56% to 44%."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-northern-ireland-36614443

attributes.action: Citizens must pass GCSE level maths and English to vote
attributes.background: Citizens under the age of 18 are unable to vote due to not being mature enough to understand implications of elections and referendums. However, maturity should not be determined by age.
attributes.additional_details:
Passing basic mathematical and English competency tests will ensure voters are able to better make informed choices, and understand the implications and consequences of their voting choice. 

Very often voters are misinformed, and unable to distinguish fact from fiction due to their lack of education. It should therefore go without saying that not being able to understand basic maths and English should also correlate with poor understanding of elections and referendums.

attributes.action: Repeal Scotland Act 1998 and 2016 Amendments and dissolve Holyrood
attributes.background: On 26th June First Minister Nicola Sturgeon threatened to veto UK succession from the EU despite the country voting by over 1.2 million votes to leave. Such action is in contravention to democratic will. Westminster should reverse Scottish devolution to prevent the SNP's constitutional overreach

attributes.action: We the people of Britain demand more funds to strengthen the NHS.
attributes.background:
As we know the wonderful NHS is failing the people of Britain due to big"cuts" and we stress that more cuts will end the NHS and certainly lead to a weaker and unhealthy Britain. 
I call on the government to put more effort and funds into the NHS to strengthen its weakness. Who is with me on this.
attributes.additional_details: Online researchers have carried out a questionnaire on the failure of the NHS the outcome is shameful, Also the amount of hospitals closing in Britain is dreadful this is due to "Cuts" and lack of funds, and the taxpayers pay in to receive a good strong Heath system. It's time to strengthen are NHS and fast, we the people of Britain demand more funding NOW! Number of deaths that occurred under the  conservative government is very high.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to display a halal food sign in businesses serving halal food.
attributes.background: All businesses serving halal food should clearly display a sign at the entrance of their establishment stating that the food they serve is halal. This would allow people of the Muslim faith to clearly identify where they are permitted to eat and Sikhs to identify where they cannot eat.

attributes.action: Keep the UK in the single market and continue to allow free movement of people
attributes.background:
On 23 June 2016 the people of the UK decided that European integration had gone too far.

However we believe that the UK must continue to be part of the single market and continue to allow free movement of people.
attributes.additional_details:
The single market has obviously benefitted the UK economically. Freedom of movement, one of the four freedoms of the single market, is also a basic human right.

Immigration to the UK has had a positive effect on our country. Keeping the borders open means people can continue to work and contribute in this great country and make it even better. And the people of the UK can continue to travel and contribute in the rest of Europe.

attributes.action: Hold an EU referendum where it is illegal  to knowingly misrepresent the facts
attributes.background: Many people voted in The EU referendum based on statements which campaign Leaders have admitted were mistakes.  We believe there would have been a different outcome if it was illegal to make false representations to the public and call on the outcome to be set aside and a new referendum to be held

attributes.action: Stop government invoking Article 50 until there is a deal in UK's interests.
attributes.background: Most MPs, who are well aware of their constituents interests, support remaining in the EU.  They are the appropriate people to judge if deal is in the U.K.'s interests.  MPs should have the power to to ensure their constituents interests are safeguarded before there is an exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Give EU nationals living in the UK for 4 years or more automatic citizenship now
attributes.background:
We are asking parliament give citizenship to EU migrants living in the UK for more than 4 years to:

- prevent the loss of skilled workers
- honour year long contributions into the system 
- give re-assurance to over 3m EU migrants 
- make sure in future all views are represented and respected
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is not meant to be exclusive. Non-EU migrants have a clear set of defined rules however hence our friends are covered already and know where the road gores - WE DO NOT and need answers now from a country that has left us hanging. We represent almost 5% of the UK pubic - yet have no voice. 
4 years are based on the decisions made in the re-negotiations between the UK and the EU commission in Feb 2016. This petition follows the same rational (4 years entitle to benefits for example)

attributes.action: Reform our parliamentary system in the wake of the UK's vote for independence.
attributes.background: One argument put forward by the Leave campaign was that the EU was undemocratic. This message undoubtedly struck a chord with many voters who feel disenfranchised. Yet Brexit will not solve this since our parliamentary system remains inherently unrepresentative for the following reasons:
attributes.additional_details:
- The House of Lords is unelected.
- First Past the Post is unrepresentative. UKIP (3881129) and Greens (1157613) needed vastly more voters per MP than Labour (40290) or Conservatives (34245) (https://www.opendemocracy.net/ourkingdom/liam-anderson/voters-per-mp-why-first-past-post-failed).

The following should happen before the next election:
- The House of Lords be replaced with an elected Second Chamber.
- A debate (and possible referendum) over the best voting system (PR, STV, AV+, FPTP).

attributes.action: Allow 17 year olds to vote in future referendums and general elections.
attributes.background: Young people in college are not allowed to vote (if they're under 18) which is extremely unfair as it is our own future. It is ridiculous that those who are 65+ have such a say in our future. Ot is undemocratic that we have no say in our future, and it needs to stop. 17 year olds deserve the vote.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on independence for London
attributes.background: Unlike the rest of the UK, London is predominantly Labour and the whole of London voted to remain in the EU. We are no longer philosophically in step with the rest of the UK. We suggest that London be afforded the opportunity to declare independence, or become part of Scotland, in a referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
London: housing crisis, Muslim Labour mayor, diverse and younger population, voted remain unanimously
Rest of UK: predominantly Conservative, voted for leaving the EU, affordable housing still exists

attributes.action: Don't scrap A level/GCSE Electronics/Systems and control. Help future engineers.
attributes.background: Scrapping these subjects will cause a fall in the amount of students leaving school with any design or electronics experience or knowledge. We should be encouraging students to become enginneers to continue advancements in technology for the future, instead this opportunity is being taken from them.
attributes.additional_details: Gonernment changes to A levels and GCSEs are moving more towards pure academia and although physics and maths are critical in technology and electronics, to be successful in the industry you must still know how to design, how a circuit works, about microchips etc. The things you are not taught in physics. Without these subjects, less people will be inspired to make their own projects and those who are inspired will be ill equipped to do so and will struggle at degree level with no experience.

attributes.action: Oppose Wigan Council Application No. A/16/82503/CU
attributes.background: Wigan Council is planning on converting Evolution Nightclub / 36-44 King Street Wigan into restaurants, cafes and residential units. This will seriously damage the nightlife in Wigan and cause many job losses. King street is made up of bars and clubs and employs hundreds of people.
attributes.additional_details: If this plan goes ahead, it will mean that the bars and clubs on King street may receive noise complaints and may have to reduce their noise levels and operating hours. Wigan cannot afford any more unemployment in the town and many of the staff are now worried that they could lose their jobs over this. King street is dependant on its nightlife and see's 1000's of customers every week. Having a residential area in the middle of the street is only the start of what negative's it will bring

attributes.action: Mindfulness Meditation on the Curriculum
attributes.background: Add mindfulness meditation to the school curriculum to tackle the issues of stress, anxiety and poor concentration amongst young people.
attributes.additional_details: The Science Behind Mindfulness Meditation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wP9731bDJlE

attributes.action: Ban letting agents from charging letting fees to renters.
attributes.background: Renters are hit with high costs every time they move. It is time to bring an end to expensive letting fees which are already banned in Scotland and which allow letting agents to unfairly 'double charge' both the landlord and the tenant.

attributes.action: Place more stringent requirements on school meals that are served at break.
attributes.background: Currently, at our school, the main meals are healthy, the menu varies and the quality of the produce is high, but as not all of the standards on health, quality and variety apply to break food, the same things are served every day. Fruit is there, but this is expensive and placed in a corner.
attributes.additional_details:
All school health standards should be applied to all meal servings, along with more defined legislation regarding variety and quality, especially for food served at mid-morning break. This will allow students to eat healthier options, eat a variety​ of food and know what they are consuming, no matter the time, is of high quality.

Food served at mid-morning break includes:
Pizza slices
Belgian Waffles - which are sprinkled in sugar
Donuts
Paninis
Bacon and cheese rolls - where there is 1cm of fat on each piece of bacon

attributes.action: Contribution to cost of teachers' holidays during Half-term and Summer holidays
attributes.background: Teachers work very hard for little pay. Often they cannot afford the holidays they deserve during their only allocated holiday time, as prices skyrocket during school holidays.
attributes.additional_details: As many people are aware prices to travel abroad or even to enjoy a holiday in the UK skyrocket outside of term time (during school holidays and half term). While parents have the option to take students out of school to avoid such price hikes teachers do not, as it is their duty to teach every single day. I believe teachers should receive a discount or monetary contribution towards holidays during half-term and Summer holidays.

attributes.action: Referendum to change Britain into a secular republic with an elected  president.
attributes.background: We must give the British people a voice over the one that has stolen our voice.
attributes.additional_details: It's an embarrassment to democracy for us to have an unelected head of state. The Monarchy system is old fashioned and out-dated. Not only is it undemocratic but the British taxpayer spends billions of pounds to an the British monarchy when it could be used to save the NHS and solve the housing crisis in Britain. British society is based on meritocracy and how can Britain claim this with a rich blood-line monarchy which is based on birth.

attributes.action: Standardise Breastfeeding Advice & Support
attributes.background: Breastfeeding can be hard to establish without correct support or advice. Many mothers turn to formula and regret not being able to breastfeed. I found it incredibly confusing, being given conflicting advice from one midwife to the next, and found it daughting when I went home from hospital.
attributes.additional_details: You may have heard the saying: Breast is Best, but in the UK we have a considerably low number of breastfeeding mothers compared to other European countries. A lot of mothers turn to formula through lack of support or advice. So this petition is aimed at standardising the support and advice given. We need a better structure in place to help breastfeeding mothers to establish, maintain and continue breastfeeding for as long as they wish to nurse their baby/toddler.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 14
attributes.background: Lower the voting age to 14 so that this give a better chance for the young to have a go

attributes.action: MPs and council leaders should cease second occupations until they leave office.
attributes.background: To prevent conflict of interest in the political arena, any person representing the PEOPLE should cease any activities that produce a second income.
attributes.additional_details: When persons are employed by the public purse they should put 100% of their effort into their job. It is known that some tenders for works within the public sector have directly and indirectly benefited State employed individuals. This is morally wrong and adds to the current lack of trust the Public have in our Government and Councils.

attributes.action: Wood burning stoves should require a licence and regulated for nuisance.
attributes.background: Wood stoves create smoke and fumes that are unpleasant and dangerous to health. The government see these devices as cheap energy. Smoke and fumes produce particulates as harmful to health as diesels or secondary cigarette smoke. This fashion accessory is dangerous not romantic.
attributes.additional_details:
Building regulations are in force to ensure construction is safe, the clean air act is there to make the air we breath as safe as possible,  Environmental Health officers are there to prevent nuisance. 
Building control ignore there own rules and do not take notice of wind effect on the way smoke and fumes enter homes, Environmental Health are reluctant to make a nuisance case because the government policy is to support them, the clean air act is ignored. You cannot keep smoke and fumes out of your home and those with a duty of care ignore the risks. Even DEFRA do not know the full risks in there support of wood burning. Once installed of course anything is burnt. They need regulating and licencing.

attributes.action: Please include a 'Return to Sender Address' on your pro-EU Referendum leaflet.
attributes.background: Include a return to sender address
attributes.additional_details: 16 pages of unsolicited mail requires a return to sender address.

attributes.action: Prevent women from fighting in close combat roles in the British Armed Forces.
attributes.background:
- If a woman wants to serve on the frontline, they need to meet the same physical criteria as men, otherwise lives will be put at risk.
- It would cause discontent among serving members of the armed forces, with many threatening to leave if this becomes policy.
attributes.additional_details:
- Women should not qualify for combat roles with lower physical capabilities, for example they might have to carry a heavy male, with full armour to save his life.

- It would cloud judgement of male counterparts, who would instinctively choose to save a woman if two people's lives were in danger, despite not always being the right decision to take.

- Women, in the main, cannot carry 110lb on their back (as soldiers in Afghanistan did).

- There are already many combat roles open to women.

attributes.action: Allow news agencies unrestricted filming in the central lobby of Parliament
attributes.background:
Under present rules, only authorised photography is allowed. 

The UK is fortunate to have one of the world’s great public service broadcasters, not a state broadcaster. As such it is the role of government to allow public scrutiny of interactions and protests, even those critical of the state.
attributes.additional_details:
At lunchtime on 23rd March 2016, during Prime Ministers Questions, Black Rod, the official with responsibility for the parliamentary estates and security, ordered reporters not to take or tweet photos of a protest in the Central Lobby of the Palace of Westminster. 

The BBC’s Norman Smith, who has permission to broadcast from the central lobby, was ordered by the authorities to stop filming mid-broadcast.

http://tinyurl.com/BlackRodVideo

The democratic process must not be subject to censorship

attributes.action: Increase the number of physiotherapists in the NHS.
attributes.background:
Waiting times from a GP referral vary from 2 weeks to 3 months or more.
Prompter physiotherapy would:
1. Increase patient mobility, strength, coordination, confidence and well-being.
2. Prevent deterioration or accidents, thereby reducing treatment costs.
3. Reduce pressure on GPs and hospitals.

attributes.action: Save Violet Melchett Health Centre in Chelsea from Closure
attributes.background: Not only is it for family planning, the fantastic team also specialises in women's health and have helped me personally on numerous occasions with same day appointments, when I wasn't able to get an appointment with my GP. It would be a great loss to the Chelsea community if this centre closes.
attributes.additional_details:
https://community.avaaz.org/petitions/save-the-violet-melchett-health-centre-in-chelsea-1 

Chelsea may soon be losing its last remaining family planning clinic in plans being drawn up by the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea (RBKC) and the NHS, residents and staff have reported. This is despite sexual health diagnoses running at a three year high.

If plans to relocate the Violet Melchett family planning clinic are executed, Chelsea will be left without a dedicated primary family planning clinic.

attributes.action:
Pay carers fair rate
Currently get £73.10wk for35 hrs of care
That's £2.08ph
attributes.background:
Adult carer's currently get £2.08 per hour for providing up to 35 hours of care a week,
The minimum wage is currently £6.70 for over 21.
Let's improve the quality of life for BOTH cared for and carer's PLEASE.
I hear if you are a member of house of Lords you get £350.00 a day for just turning up.
attributes.additional_details:
I am an Independent disabled man.
I was damaged by accidents during surgery.
I need a fair amount of care at times.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use power tools past 20:00 hours in home D.I.Y
attributes.background: We all suffer nuisance neighbours from time to time.  If there is a law then it makes life easier to destinguish right and wrongs.  If there is a 20:00hrs stoppage to mechanical D.I.Y it makes people consider others and what they are putting them through.
attributes.additional_details: The reason I am bringing this to the for is because I have had a neighbour starting work at 15:00 approx and continuing until 22:00plus for over two months.  I have a son studying for his GCSE exams and we all work and just want to relax.  The other side have young children.  I have asked them to stop earlier and it has fallen on deaf ears with complete denial.  I feel this is a reasonable request that will make life more harmonial whilst still allowing what needs to be done, the time to do it.

attributes.action: Oppose plans  for responsibility all asylum claims being shifted to the EASO
attributes.background: The FT has brought to our attention plans to make the an EU agency (European Asylum Support Office) responsible for all asylum claims within the EU including the UK, this will mean the UK government will lose control over immigration policy for people arriving from OUTSIDE the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The story was broken by the Financial times on the 7th March and was also featured on Yahoo news:

http://news.yahoo.com/brussels-propose-overhaul-eu-asylum-system-report-001724988.html

Whether you think we should take more or less non EU migrants surely the member states and not the EU should decide it's migration policy not the EU.

I think we should have assurances of the government position on this issue and whether the Prime Minister and leader of the opposition will oppose these changes.

attributes.action: An accused should have the right to total anonymity until a verdict is passed.
attributes.background: The legal assumption that a person is innocent until proven guilty is being degraded by a scandal thirsty media, aided by modern communication technology. An accused should therefore be protected through a legal right to total anonymity until a verdict is passed, in order to receive a fair trial.

attributes.action: Make it law that employees are given a day off in lieu for 29 February.
attributes.background: Regardless of what day of the week 29 February falls on, ultimately every 4 years employees are expected to work an extra day, without additional pay. Employers should give employees an extra day off work in lieu every 4 years.

attributes.action: To revoke British Citizenship and passport if you commit a crime
attributes.background: To make a law that any person given British Citizenship and passport who commits a criminal offence and are jailed then the British Citizenship and passport are revoked and they are deported to their country of origin.
